items.text: Verify power disconnect is locked out
items.details: Before starting work, ensure the main power disconnect is locked out and tagged so that the panel can be worked on safely and no one can re-energize it during the inspection.
Confirm the voltage at the panel (e.g. 120/208 V, 347/600 V) so that the correct test equipment and PPE are used and the single-line diagram can be verified.
Review the single-line diagram before testing so that you understand the system layout, feeder sources, and protective devices and can verify them against the installation.
Perform a torque check on main lugs per manufacturer specifications to ensure connections are tight. Loose connections can overheat and cause failure or fire.
Use a thermal imaging camera or similar to scan connections under load. Hot spots indicate loose or failing connections that should be corrected.
Verify that grounding and bonding connections are continuous and secure so that fault current has a reliable path and touch voltage is controlled.
Document all breaker settings (trip, delay, etc.) so that coordination can be verified and future changes can be compared to the as-built condition.
Ensure arc flash labels reflect the current system configuration and fault current so that workers have accurate incident energy and PPE information.
Keep the coordination study on file so that selective coordination can be verified and future modifications can be checked against the study.
Verify arc flash calculations and labels against the installed system so that PPE and approach boundaries remain correct after any changes.
